title: Husband of Trump adviser Kellyanne Conway says Republicans could flip on president during impeachment process
text:
‘Guilty’

That’s the word that George Conway, fierce Trump critic and husband of White House counselor Kellyanne Conway, said we could hear from Republicans when they come out of hiding and break from the president.

I agree with this. There may be Republican senators who won’t say a word until the moment they say “guilty” when the roll is called at the end of an impeachment trial. https://t.co/zQJ8xnEfeW — George Conway (@gtconway3d) September 25, 2019

His tweet follows Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s announcement late Tuesday marking the beginning of a formal impeachment process. But even before the official word, Conway was pushing hard for Democrats to make their move.

“Trump has already done more than enough to warrant impeachment and removal,” he wrote in an op-ed in the Washington Post last week. “The current whistleblowing allegations, however, are even worse.”

Meanwhile, Trump, who once slammed Conway as “a stone cold LOSER and husband from hell” is calling it another witch hunt:

Will the Democrats apologize after seeing what was said on the call with the Ukrainian President? They should, a perfect call - got them by surprise! — Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) September 25, 2019

A rough transcript summarizing the call released Wednesday showed Trump repeatedly prodded Ukraine’s new leader to work with Rudy Giuliani and the U.S. attorney general to investigate Democratic political rival Joe Biden.
description: George Conway, fierce Trump critic and husband of White House counselor Kellyanne Conway, said we could hear from Republicans when they come out of hiding...
